content: Stadium in Singapore The **Clementi Stadium** is a [multi-purpose stadium](/wiki/Multi-purpose_stadium) in [Clementi](/wiki/Clementi,_Singapore), Singapore. It has a seating capacity of 4,000. It is managed by the [Sport Singapore](/wiki/Sport_Singapore), which took over on 21 February 1983, and opened it to the public on 1 April the same year. Clementi Stadium houses a grass football pitch, an 8-lane running track and partial athletic facilities. People can be seen running around the track daily as [Sport Singapore](/wiki/Sport_Singapore) allows joggers to use the track facilities between 4:30 am to 9:30 pm for free. ## History The stadium was home to a football club, [Clementi Khalsa](/wiki/Clementi_Khalsa) in the [S.League](/wiki/S-league) before they went on to merged with [Balestier Central](/wiki/Balestier_Khalsa_FC) and vacated the Clementi Stadium at the end of 2002. Rallies prior to the [2011 Singaporean general election](/wiki/2011_Singaporean_general_election) by the [Reform Party](/wiki/Reform_Party_(Singapore)) were held here. In 2011, [Tanjong Pagar United](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_United_FC) was temporary based at Clementi for the duration of the [2011 S.League season](/wiki/2011_S.League) as their home ground was occupied by French club, [Étoile FC](/wiki/%C3%89toile_FC). The following year, During the construction of [Our Tampines Hub](/wiki/Our_Tampines_Hub), [Tampines Rovers](/wiki/Tampines_Rovers_FC) used Clementi Stadium as their temporary home ground from 2012 to 2014. - Frank Jasperneite page 1°18′35″N 103°45′47″E﻿ / ﻿1.309845°N 103.763015°E﻿ / 1.309845; 103.763015 This article about a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) sports venue is a stub.
